stories.title: WSJ Ends Google Users' Free Ride, Then Fades in Search Results (2017)

stories.text:
I see some really nice presentations here and there with amazing clip arts, pictures, etc.

I wonder if there is a source to get such clip arts, public domain or paid, as a bundle. Or those presenters are drawing and making the presentations themselves.

Long ago, when I was young and more into presenting there were the bundles that one could buy and add to MS PowerPoint and use freely. I do not know if that is still the case or if it has changed since then.

If the presenters are mostly drawing their own clip arts, what hardware and software are the most commonly used?
stories.title: Ask HN: Where do you get clip arts for presentations?

Target protein for diabetes drug linked to reduced risk of Alzheimer's disease

stories.text:
I have recently started an agency that makes the early age startups/businesses a brand. It's been 5+ years, since I have been working as a freelancer or providing services to clients. But this time, I am really struggling with growth. 
I don't know if it's my filter on what type of clients I want or my approach, but I really am under the water in getting new clients. Would love if someone can guide me out.
stories.title: Struggling with the growth, need guidance for my agency

stories.text:

stories.title: Ask HN: Website listing interesting pre-IPO startups that are hiring
